alert.note: Alert for South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 23 at 3:10AM MST until November 25 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WINTER STORM ARRIVING THANKSGIVING EVENING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 6 inches, heaviest east of the Continental Divide. * WHERE...The Mountains of Summit County, the Mosquito Range, and the Indian Peaks. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Roads will likely become slick and hazardous. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org. Roads will be slick resulting in slow and hazardous travel. Allow extra time to reach your destination.

area.areaDesc: South and Southeast Grand, West Central and Southwest Boulder, Gilpin, Clear Creek, Summit, North and West Park Counties Above 9000 Feet
